Character.name: Loadletter
intro: Loadletter seems to have a way with words.

attacks.name: Lid Smash
dialog: Loadletter chomps down on you with the lid of his scanner.
You note the impressiveness of his bite strength, amidst the pain.

attacks.name: Inkblot
dialog: Loadletter sprays you with a mighty gout of ink.
It's almost the sheer cost of the ink that hurts, more than the stinging in your eyes.

attacks.name: Cold Shoulder
dialog: Loadletter gets suspiciously quiet, utterly ignoring the last print job he was sent, which seems to have vanished without a trace.

attacks.name: Papercut
dialog: Loadletter spits a full ream of paper at you, as quickly as he can fire it.
You can only dodge so many.

followup: Loadletter's eyes seem to flicker with recognition.
You wonder if it's possible he has feelings, deep enough down.

replies.text: Do you even have any friends?
followup: Loadletter's lid closes slightly, as if to recoil.
You're not totally sure he even understands you, but it's seeming possible.

replies.text: I hope you like jammin' too...

followup: Loadletter's eyes glint as if he is considering your words.
You remind yourself this could just be his scanning you for weaknesses.

replies.text: Print this black rectangle for me?
Do those buttons even do anything?
You don't have to be alone!
followup: Loadletter closes his lid, and goes quiet.

replies: Loadletter doesn't even seem to recognize the function of such a device.
He lets loose a mighty roar, but you're pretty sure he did that just because.
Loadletter doesn't even seem to recognize the function of such a device.
He growls menacingly, but when is he ever not doing that?
Loadletter seems to examine the camera, and realizes it's full color.
Something like irritation seems to flicker in his eyes, perhaps at the thought of needing to waste his color ink.
Loadletter seems to recognize the receiver, and looks annoyed.
You get the impression he would rather not have to mess with his wireless settings yet another time in his life.

win: Loadletter: Rargh rargh rarghrargh, rargh rargh raaargh rargh.
Loadletter: Rargh, rarghrarghragh rargh rargh, rargh rargh-rargh; rargh... rargh.
You certainly have no earthly idea what he's saying, but the cadence of his groans and beeping seems to have softened.
To your surprise, he even sounds like he might not be picturing your murder.
You extend a hand of friendship to him, and he considers it thoughtfully for a long moment.
From the look in his cold LED eyes, you get the distinct impression he would like to come with you.
He detaches a tiny spool and print head, and offers it to you with a gesture of either friendship, or at least not-murder.
lose: Loadletter seems pretty confident in his ability to defeat you, and begins to ignore you.
Perhaps he would consider you as an adversary again if you came back stronger?
